Moved F-22

I guess I do have a few.

A very light in parts (230!) Apollo replica, Project Phoebus:

Chibi-Shuttle, the Kerbal Transportation System. Part count is too small to care (75, if you do). Look at those segmented SRB's, shame I didn't manage to fit the four I started with:

And the last one, a N1-L3 that I think is spot on aesthetically. A bit more parts than usual, but it is also not unusable at 400 on the pad (when you drop the first stage, you drop >150 parts).

Rune. All available at R-SUV!

Edited January 28, 2014 by Rune

P-80 Shooting Star

Designed for FAR, and deliberately made to not be overpowered. It is the first practical jet in my Kerbal career mod timeline. I still haven't even orbited Kerbin, instead focusing on the origins of the Kerbal Space Program.

Edited January 29, 2014 by Bloodbunny

Well, this thread has surpassed my post count! Officially!

Good job guys! Keep up the good work!

Wish my computer could run KSP *grumble grumble*
That's a very nice P-80. I love the exhaust in the tail. Sorry for being a bit too picky but just pointing out that it doesn't carry machine guns on the wings but 8x50cals in the nose.

That's a very nice P-80. I love the exhaust in the tail. Sorry for being a bit too picky but just pointing out that it doesn't carry machine guns on the wings but 8x50cals in the nose.

Yeah, it has nose guns too. Sadly, I could only fit 4 on the nose without getting really ugly clipping issues, so I had to divert from realism a bit.

Finally finished my newest project, I went with something quite nice looking:

The F9F Panther. The engine was a bit tricky to get in there.

Well, atleast i tried.

Stock YF-12A replica

Let me introduce you the YF-12A, it was a prototype based on the platform of the A-12 (the base of the sr 71 too).

It was build to be the faster interceptor ever made, armed with 3 missiles, due to the modification of the nose for radar sistems the aerodinamic was changed, so it was necessary put fins under engines and under the tail. It was faster than sr 71, with at least 100km/h more, for a total maximum speed of 3700km/h.

My replica tryes to reproduce this plane better possiblem not only in design but also in performance, so my replica goes to a maximum speed of about 3800km/h and reach a max altitude of 24000m.

This is my craft painted in black and white with kerbpaint like i have seen in this image:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

-Max speed 3800km/h

-Max altitude 24000m

-Good handling

-good fuel load (can be raised or lowered)

-Ejection system, don't let your kerbal die!!!!

DOWNLOAD

colored version http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/yf-12a-5/

Well... You tried! I mean, it's a very nice replica aircraft, but could probably have been done a little bit better. But nice!

Stock YF-12A replica

Let me introduce you the YF-12A, it was a prototype based on the platform of the A-12 (the base of the sr 71 too).

It was build to be the faster interceptor ever made, armed with 3 missiles, due to the modification of the nose for radar sistems the aerodinamic was changed, so it was necessary put fins under engines and under the tail. It was faster than sr 71, with at least 100km/h more, for a total maximum speed of 3700km/h.

My replica tryes to reproduce this plane better possiblem not only in design but also in performance, so my replica goes to a maximum speed of about 3800km/h and reach a max altitude of 24000m.

This is my craft painted in black and white with kerbpaint like i have seen in this image:

http://www.cybermodeler.com/aircraft/sr-71/images/yf-12_profile01.png

http://imgur.com/a/ZNYLs

-Max speed 3800km/h

-Max altitude 24000m

-Good handling

-good fuel load (can be raised or lowered)

-Ejection system, don't let your kerbal die!!!!

Awesome! Is it stock? (Also, the ejection system isn't needed... LET YOUR KERBAL DIE FOR HIS MISTAKE OF SIGNING ON TO BE AN ASTRONAUT!!!)

Awesome crafts, guys! I'd love to see more! Mr. Pneusodym, over to you!

Awesome! Is it stock? (Also, the ejection system isn't needed... LET YOUR KERBAL DIE FOR HIS MISTAKE OF SIGNING ON TO BE AN ASTRONAUT!!!)

Awesome crafts, guys! I'd love to see more! Mr. Pneusodym, over to you!

Yes it is totally stock, the special colour is done with kerbpaint plugin

I posted this a while ago for .22, but as it's own post, didn't get much attention. I'm really proud of this thing, and wanted others to love it.

I present, Kerbin Galactic's commercial craft, White Knight Two, and Spaceship Two:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

This was before the tweakables, so I had to use FAR to tweak the control surfaces correctly. I might just have to go in there and update it to the current version!
Looks awesome! Although, to me it seems like SpaceShipOne can't land, considering the large explotion! Great, mate!

No, I just chose the wrong place to land....which was on the face of a mountain

It certainly can land, but I just wanted to show that it is...difficult, since you're on an unpowered glide from orbital heights.
